text: when the doctor came in and told us told
me that the test was positive I just
started crying my initial thoughts were
I don't understand we stayed at home we
pulled him out of activities that was
immediately followed by oh my gosh he
has coronavirus and he continues to get
worse every single hour where is this
headed and how bad is this gonna get
what I found most helpful to me in the
hospital was just trying to stay present
in the moment and not let my mind wander
too far down the what if what if he gets
worse what if he gets intubated what if
he gets sedated I never let myself go to
the what if he doesn't come home I just
wasn't willing to go to that place and
it's really hard to do that as they're
turning up the oxygen every hour but it
did really help me
what everybody obviously loved us today
still a little too young just what they
let it show so young I just don't know
if I'm baby you give up any more pain
yet I mean daddy no because I speed
obviously do that point maybe the
sealosaurus mess them up there
my hope is that I don't become somebody
who's so overly cautious that I don't
allow them to live their lives but this
just really drove at home that my time
with my kids is precious
I don't want any parent to be in a
position of I call it the shoulda coulda
woulda's I should have stayed at home I
wish I would have stayed at home of
regretting the choices they made because
their child gets sick it's much easier
on a parent to say I did everything
possible and this still happened then oh
my gosh we took them to a playground and
we didn't take it seriously and look my
kid is in the hospital on a ventilator
